entry.et: Middle English, from Anglo-French poete, from Latin poeta, from Greek poiētēs maker, poet, from poiein to make; akin to Sanskrit cinoti he gathers, heaps up

def.dt: :one who writes poetry :a maker of verses
:one (as a creative artist) of great imaginative and expressive capabilities and special sensitivity to the medium
:a poet appointed for life by an English sovereign as a member of the royal household and formerly expected to compose poems for court and national occasions
:a poet appointed annually by the United States Library of Congress as a consultant and typically involved in the promotion of poetry
:one regarded by a country or region as its most eminent or representative poet
:a composition in prose that has some of the qualities of a poem
